Histology Page 10
[H1] Week 2 Histo Review and Lookalikes.
Wednesday, January 16, 2008
[LIST_ITEM] Salivary Gland vs. Pancreas
[LIST_ITEM] Salivary gland has striated ducts - cuboidal epithelium
[LIST_ITEM] Both have intercalated ducts - flat squamous epithelium
[LIST_ITEM] Pancreas has centroacinar cells
[LIST_ITEM] Intestine vs. Gall Bladder
[LIST_ITEM] Intestinal villi have lots of cells in core as well as blood vessels, ducts etc.
[LIST_ITEM] Gall bladder folds just have connective tissue and a less cells
[LIST_ITEM] Gall bladder has thicker muscularis mucosae
[LIST_ITEM] Pylorus vs. Duodenum
[LIST_ITEM] Look for submucosal Brunner's glands --> duodenum
[LIST_ITEM] Villi in duodenum, only pits in stomach
[LIST_ITEM] Jejunum/Ileum vs. Duodenum
[LIST_ITEM] Same thing w/ the submucosal glands
[LIST_ITEM] Cardio-esophageal jxn vs. recto-anal jxn
[LIST_ITEM] Cardio-esophageal is transition from
